list.name: Anchosnake
list.about: Anchosnake is a character in Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Rattlestar Ricklactica.' The curious fact about Anchosnake is that it is a snake version of an anchorman, complete with a snake-shaped suit and a microphone. This character highlights the show's ability to incorporate clever wordplay and visual puns into its character designs. It adds a humorous touch to the episode and showcases the show's attention to detail when it comes to creating a vibrant and diverse snake society.

list.name: 80's snake
list.about: The 80's Snake is a character that appears in the episode 'Rattlestar Ricklactica.' The curious fact about the 80's Snake is that it embodies the fashion and style of the 1980s, complete with neon colors, big hair, and retro attire. This character serves as a humorous homage to the '80s era and its distinct aesthetics. It adds a nostalgic element to the episode and showcases the show's ability to incorporate pop culture references into its storytelling, creating a fun and entertaining character.

list.name: Bar Customer
list.about: The Bar Customer is a character that appears in various episodes of Rick and Morty. The curious fact about the Bar Customer is that the character is often shown engaged in bizarre and outrageous activities in the background of bar scenes. This character serves as an Easter egg for attentive viewers who enjoy spotting hidden details in the show. It adds an extra layer of humor and surprise to the episodes, rewarding observant fans with unexpected and amusing moments.

list.name: Bartender
list.about: The Bartender is a recurring character in Rick and Morty who appears in various episodes. The curious fact about the Bartender is that despite being a background character, the show often includes subtle hints and references to the bartender's mysterious past and hidden depths. These hints are cleverly woven into the dialogue and visual cues, leaving viewers speculating about the bartender's backstory and role in the larger narrative. It adds a sense of intrigue and mystery to the character, elevating their presence beyond a typical background role.

list.name: PC Basketball Player
list.about: The PC Basketball Player is a character that appears in the episode 'Auto Erotic Assimilation.' The curious fact about the PC Basketball Player is that it represents a satirical take on political correctness and the culture of performative activism. This character embodies the exaggerated and often absurd lengths some individuals go to showcase their supposed progressiveness. It serves as a social commentary, critiquing the tendency to prioritize appearances and virtue signaling over genuine action and meaningful change.

list.name: Cavesnake
list.about: Cavesnake is a character that appears in the episode 'Rickmancing the Stone.' The curious fact about Cavesnake is that it is a large snake that resides in an underground cave and guards a valuable resource. This character adds an element of danger and adventure to the episode's storyline, as Rick and Morty must navigate the treacherous caves and outsmart the Cavesnake to obtain the resource. It showcases the show's ability to incorporate thrilling action sequences and unexpected obstacles for the main characters to overcome.

list.name: Pet Shop Employee
list.about: The Pet Shop Employee is a character that appears in the episode 'Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate.' The curious fact about the Pet Shop Employee is that they have the ability to communicate with alien creatures and understand their needs and desires. This character highlights the show's imaginative world-building and showcases the diversity of species and interdimensional beings in the Rick and Morty universe. It adds a touch of whimsy and wonder to the episode, as the Pet Shop Employee interacts with extraordinary creatures in a seemingly ordinary setting.

list.name: Snake Reporter
list.about: The Snake Reporter is a character in Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Get Schwifty.' The curious fact about the Snake Reporter is that it reports news exclusively through hissing sounds, translating the serpentine language into human-understandable information. This character adds a unique and comical element to the episode, showcasing the show's ability to play with communication methods and linguistic quirks. It also emphasizes the show's satirical take on media and journalism, presenting a snake reporter as a humorous commentary on news reporting.

list.name: High Pilot
list.about: The High Pilot is a character that appears in the episode 'Something Ricked This Way Comes.' The curious fact about the High Pilot is that they are an interdimensional pilot who operates under the influence of mind-altering substances. This character adds a surreal and psychedelic element to the episode, reflecting the show's willingness to explore unconventional themes and experiences. It also serves as a humorous commentary on the idea of a pilot responsible for interdimensional travel being in an altered state of consciousness, adding an extra layer of absurdity to the show's universe.

list.name: Phoenixperson
list.about: Phoenixperson is a character in Rick and Morty who is introduced in the episode 'The Rickshank Rickdemption.' The curious fact about Phoenixperson is that he is a resurrected version of Birdperson, a character from earlier seasons. After being killed, Birdperson is brought back to life as a cybernetic being loyal to Tammy, his former love interest turned antagonist. Phoenixperson's return adds a layer of emotional complexity to the show, as well as an ongoing storyline and conflict between him and the main characters.

list.name: Tickets Please Guy
list.about: The Tickets Please Guy is a character that appears in the episode 'Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.' The curious fact about the Tickets Please Guy is that he possesses the ability to control and manipulate tickets with his mind. This character showcases the show's ability to create unique and unconventional superpowers, even for minor characters. It adds a touch of whimsy and creativity to the episode, as the Tickets Please Guy uses his ticket manipulation skills to aid or hinder the main characters.

list.name: Floaty Bloody Man
list.about: Floaty Bloody Man is a character that appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run.' The curious fact about Floaty Bloody Man is that he is a mysterious figure who floats in mid-air, leaving a trail of blood behind him. This character adds an element of intrigue and mystery to the episode, as his purpose and origin remain ambiguous. It creates an eerie atmosphere and showcases the show's ability to incorporate unsettling and enigmatic elements into its storytelling.

list.name: Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member
list.about: The Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member is a character that appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run.' The curious fact about the Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member is that he is a member of a group that rejects the idea of achieving orgasm. This character serves as a satirical commentary on societal norms and expectations surrounding pleasure and sexuality. It adds a humorous and thought-provoking element to the episode, challenging conventional beliefs and exploring alternative perspectives.

list.name: Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member Friend
list.about: The Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member Friend is a character that appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run.' The curious fact about the Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member Friend is that he is a companion of the Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood Member and shares their beliefs and lifestyle choices. This character adds depth and camaraderie to the episode, showcasing the bonds formed within the Floaty Non-Gasm Brotherhood and their shared rejection of conventional norms. It adds an extra layer of humor and social commentary to the episode's narrative.

list.name: Abradolf Lincler
list.about: Abradolf Lincler is a character in Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Ricksy Business.' The curious fact about Abradolf Lincler is that he is a genetic hybrid of Abraham Lincoln and Adolf Hitler created by Rick Sanchez. This character showcases the show's ability to combine historical figures in unexpected and absurd ways, generating both humor and thought-provoking moments. Abradolf Lincler's existence raises questions about morality, identity, and the consequences of tampering with genetics.

list.name: Biblesaurus
list.about: Biblesaurus is a character that appears in the episode 'Big Trouble in Little Sanchez.' The curious fact about Biblesaurus is that it is a dinosaur-like creature with the appearance of a living Bible. This character serves as a humorous juxtaposition between religious symbolism and prehistoric imagery. It adds a touch of irreverence and satire to the episode, challenging the notion of sacred texts and presenting them in an unexpected and comical form.

list.name: Birdperson
list.about: Birdperson is a character in Rick and Morty who appears in various episodes. The curious fact about Birdperson is that he is a close friend of Rick Sanchez and shares a deep connection with him. Despite his avian appearance, Birdperson possesses wisdom and philosophical insights that often provide guidance to the main characters. This character adds depth and emotional resonance to the show, highlighting the importance of companionship and the complexities of interpersonal relationships.

list.name: Cats Fan
list.about: The Cats Fan is a character that appears in the episode 'Total Rickall.' The curious fact about the Cats Fan is that he is an enthusiastic supporter of cat-related content and merchandise. This character showcases the show's ability to incorporate quirky and niche interests into its narrative. It adds a humorous touch to the episode and highlights the absurdity of fandoms and dedicated enthusiasts. The Cats Fan's presence serves as a comedic element, contributing to the overall comedic tone of the episode.
